message.content:
cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.SY, cs.IT. 

The paper discusses a new algorithm for local thresholding in general network graphs, which is applicable to a variety of data mining tasks in peer-to-peer systems, wireless sensor networks, and grid systems. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms), cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.SY (Systems and Control), and cs.IT (Information Theory). However, given the focus on network graphs and distributed systems, cs.DS and cs.NI are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the implementation and validation of the algorithm on a standard peer-to-peer simulator, which further supports the relevance of cs.DS and cs.NI.
